description:
Watermelon Pen is Doraemon's gadget.
Blindfolded Shizuka is splitting watermelons.it used to make anything turn into watermelon.
appears_in: Doraemon Is An Exam Student Now!?

jp_name: お天気コーカン地図 Otenki Kōkan Chizu
description: The gadget can change the weather for a specific place. You need to circle the place (whose weather you want to change) in order to do so.

jp_name: おおかみ男クリーム Ōkami Otoko Kurīmu
description: If the user applies this cream on their face, then they will turn into a werewolf whenever they see a round object (like the moon). To remove the effect, simply wipe the cream off the user's face.
appears_in: Let's Turn Into the Snow Woman on Cold Days!!

jp_name: もしもボックス What-if Box
description:
The user must enter the booth, take the phone off, then say "What if ____?" , then set the phone down. Once this is done, it technically warps the user to an alternate dimension of their current world, while original world and its timeline continue on as usual[1]. Traveling future after using the gadget will result in the user arriving at the same parallel world and not the original world[2], but traveling back to the past will result in the user arriving at the original world prior to the usage of the gadget[3]. 
It is also possible to revert the machine's effects manually by using it with specific commands.
appears_in: Nobita's Great Adventure into the Underworld
Doraemon: Nobita's New Great Adventure into the Underworld – The Seven Magic Users
I'll Be the King of String Finger World
Thank God for the Prison Break
What If We Turn Day Into Night!?

description:
The Wishing Star flies to the person calling it and can grant his wishes. However, it is a subject of misunderstandings. For example, if you wish for a baked sea bream (鯛焼き Taiyaki), the gadget gives you a tire (タイヤ Taiya) and a tree (木 Ki).
However, the Wishing Star was useful on one occasion; Nobita uses it to escape Gian and Suneo and it hides him inside a trash bin.

jp_name: きこりの泉 Kikori no Izumi
description: Similar to its mythical namesake counterparts, the Woodcutter's Spring will offer a superior counterpart of an inserted item. It then asks the user which item they dropped, and will either return the updated one to them or withdraw the offer depending if they are honest. Regardless, items within its realm can't be retrieved, and each can only be used for up to 5 times.

It appears to be a mini gadget version of a normal hit man. It has some large sunglasses, a large dark green hat and a white suit and a tie underneath his green coat. His hands and legs are very small. His hands are similar to Doraemon's. 
The user pays 10 Yen(10 cents in US), declare a name of his/her target. This gadget will then knock that target up for 3 times using it Mini Air Cannon. Once the order has been declared, the Gadget will continuously chase it target until the target has been knock up 3 times. However, the order can be cancelled by paying 100 Yen(1 dollar in US).  
You can input the coins through it's back.
appears_in: Nobita Express and the Mystery of the Train Hunter
The Genius Nobita's Airship Amusement Park

description: The overal appearance of Wrestling Killer Z remains almost the same as Wrestling Killer, with little noticeable changes to its clothing. It has purple sunglasses, hot pink hat, purple coat and Z letter on its white suit.
